verses.text: 保羅帶提摩太同行保羅來到了特庇，又到了路司得。在那裡有一個門徒，名叫提摩太，是一個信主的猶太婦人的兒子，父親卻是希臘人。

words.note: Refers to believing in Jesus Christ as Lord.

verses.text: 路司得和以哥念的弟兄們都稱讚他。

words.note: Refers to fellow believers, usually men.

verses.text: 保羅有意要他一同出去，但為了那些地方的猶太人，就給他行了割禮，因為他們都知道他父親是希臘人。
他們經過各城，把耶路撒冷的使徒和長老所定的規條，交給門徒遵守。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, indicating it is disposed of or affected.
Refers to church leaders or respected older members.

verses.text: 於是眾教會信心越發堅固，人數天天增加。

words.note: Often used before nouns to mean 'all' or 'the general public'.

verses.text: 保羅見異象往馬其頓去聖靈既然禁止他們在亞西亞傳道，他們就走遍弗呂家、加拉太地區。
他們來到每西亞邊境，想要去庇推尼，耶穌的靈也不許。
他們經過每西亞，下到特羅亞。
夜間有一個異象向保羅顯現：有一個馬其頓人站著求他說：「請你到馬其頓來，幫助我們！」
保羅見了這異象，我們就認定是 神呼召我們去傳福音給他們，於是立刻設法前往馬其頓。

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence in some Chinese Bibles.
Lit. 'transmit blessed news'

verses.text: 呂底亞信主我們從特羅亞開船，直航撒摩特拉，第二天到達尼亞波利，

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'believe the Lord'
Verb-object compound, lit. 'open the boat/ship'

verses.text: 從那裡來到腓立比，就是馬其頓地區的首要城市，是羅馬的殖民地。我們在這城裡住了幾天。
安息日我們出了城門，來到河邊，以為那裡是個祈禱的地方。我們坐下，對聚集的婦女講論。
有一位敬畏 神的婦女，名叫呂底亞，是推雅推拉城賣紫色布的商人，她一直在聽，主開啟她的心，使她留心聽保羅所講的。

words.note: Refers to the singular God, often capitalized in English translations.
Specific city name mentioned in Revelation.
Refers to Jesus Christ or God.
Indicates the object of the following verb, or a passive construction.
Turns a verb/phrase into a noun phrase (e.g., 'what was spoken').

verses.text: 她和她一家受了洗以後，就請求說：「你們若認為我是對主忠實的，就請到我家來住。」於是她強留我們。

words.note: Verb-object compound: 'receive baptism'.
Refers to Jesus Christ or God.

words.definition: insist on staying, compel to stay

verses.text: 在腓立比被囚有一次，我們到祈禱的地方去的時候，一個被巫鬼附著的婢女迎面而來；她行占卜使主人們發了大財。

words.note: Lit. 'by imprisoned'
Connects verb/clause to 時候
Term for a female servant in ancient times.
Refers to forbidden practices in the Bible.
An idiomatic expression meaning 'to make a lot of money'.

verses.text: 她跟著保羅和我們，喊叫說：「這些人是至高 神的僕人，向你們傳講得救的道路。」

words.note: A space or dot used in some Chinese Bibles before '神' for reverence.
Contextually refers to the 'way of salvation'.

verses.text: 她一連多日這樣喊叫，保羅覺得厭煩，就轉身對那鬼說：「我奉耶穌基督的名，命令你從她身上出來！」那鬼就立刻出來了。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for 'by authority of'.

verses.text: 她的主人們看見發財的希望完了，就揪住保羅和西拉，拉到市中心去見官長，

words.note: Here used nominally, 'the hope of making money'.
Refers to ancient civil authorities.

verses.text: 又帶到裁判官面前，說：「這些人是猶太人，擾亂我們的城市，

words.note: Refers to Roman judicial officials.

verses.text: 傳我們羅馬人不准接受、不准實行的規例。」

words.note: Often means 'spread' or 'transmit'; here, 'proclaim'.
Connects an attribute to a noun, or nominalizes a phrase.
Refers to legal or religious ordinances.

verses.text: 群眾一齊起來攻擊他們，裁判官就剝去他們的衣服，下令用棍子打他們。

words.note: Used as a directional complement indicating upward movement or commencement.
Refers to Roman magistrates in this context.
The '去' acts as a directional complement indicating removal.

verses.text: 打了很多棍，就把他們放在監牢裡，吩咐獄吏嚴密看守。

words.note: Used as a measure word for strikes with a stick or club.
Used to prepose the object of a verb for emphasis or to indicate disposal.

verses.text: 獄吏領了命令，就把他們押入內監，兩腳拴了木狗。

words.note: Refers to the most secure part of a prison.
A specific term for an ancient wooden device used to restrain prisoners' feet.

verses.text: 保羅領獄吏全家信主約在半夜，保羅和西拉祈禱歌頌 神，囚犯們都側耳聽著。

words.note: A common phrase in Christian contexts meaning to become a believer.
A formal term for prayer.
Often used for praising God or holy figures.
An idiomatic expression for attentive listening.
Indicates an action in progress or a sustained state.

verses.text: 忽然發生了大地震，以致監牢的地基都搖動起來，所有的監門立刻開了，囚犯的鎖鍊都鬆了。

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: Common in legal/historical contexts; used throughout the Bible.
Indicates the start of an action or an upward movement.

verses.text: 獄吏醒過來，看見監門全開，以為囚犯都已經逃脫了，就拔出刀來想要自刎。

words.note: A specific term for a prison officer, common in ancient contexts.

words.definition: to wake up, to regain consciousness
to see, to catch sight of

breakdown.m: to shed, to get away from

words.definition: to draw out, to pull out

words.note: Indicates movement towards the speaker/subject.

words.definition: to want, to be about to
to commit suicide by cutting throat
words.note: A classical and literary term for suicide.

verses.text: 保羅大聲呼叫說：「不要傷害自己，我們都在這裡！」
獄吏叫人拿了燈來，就衝進去，戰戰兢兢地俯伏在保羅和西拉面前，

words.note: An idiom (chengyu) describing extreme fear or caution.
Connects an adverbial phrase to a verb.

words.definition: to prostrate oneself, to fall face down
words.note: Often implies reverence or submission in religious contexts.

verses.text: 隨後領他們出來，說：「先生，我應該作甚麼才可以得救？」

words.note: Polite address for a man.

words.definition: to be saved, to gain salvation
words.note: A core theological term in Christianity.

verses.text: 他們說：「當信主耶穌，你和你一家人都必定得救。」
他們就把主的道，講給他和所有在他家裡的人聽。

words.note: Refers to the message or teaching of God/Christ.

verses.text: 就在當夜的那個時候，獄吏領他們去洗傷，獄吏和他家人都受了洗，

words.note: A term for a prison official, common in older texts/contexts.

verses.text: 就帶他們到家裡，擺上飯食，他和全家因信了 神就大大喜樂。

words.note: Reduplication of an adjective/adverb to indicate emphasis.
A more formal or literary term for joy, often used in religious texts.

verses.text: 到了天亮，裁判官派法警來，說：「放了這些人！」

words.note: A term for a presiding judicial official, often used in historical or biblical contexts.

verses.text: 獄吏就把這話告訴保羅，說：「裁判官派人來釋放你們，現在可以出來，平平安安地去吧！」

words.note: Refers to an official in charge of a prison.
Introduces the direct object before the verb.
Refers to a Roman civil authority.
Reduplication of '平安' (peace, safety) for emphasis.
Connects an adjective/adverb to a verb.
Indicates suggestion, command, or agreement.

verses.text: 保羅對他們說：「我們是羅馬人，還沒有定罪，他們就公開打我們，又放在監裡；現在要私下趕我們出去嗎？不行！他們應當親自來，領我們出去！」

words.note: 羅馬 (Luómǎ) is the transliteration for Rome.
Often used in legal or religious contexts.
Indicates a yes-no question.

verses.text: 法警把這番話回報裁判官，裁判官聽說他們是羅馬人，就害怕起來，

words.note: Roman lictors carried fasces and enforced magistrates' orders.
Introduces the direct object before the verb.
Used to quantify a 'turn' or 'bout' of something.
Refers to a Roman civil authority.
Refers to a Roman civil authority.
羅馬 (Luómǎ) is the transliteration for Rome.
Indicates an action starting or a state coming into being.

verses.text: 於是來請求他們，領他們出監之後，就請他們離開那城。

words.note: Connects cause and effect.
Verb-object compound meaning 'exit prison'.
A common postposition or temporal conjunction.

verses.text: 兩人出了監，就到呂底亞的家裡去，見了弟兄們，勸勉他們一番，就離開了。

words.note: Indicates completion of an action.
Indicates completion of an action.
Often used for fellow Christians.

words.definition: a spell of, a round of
words.note: Often used with verbs to describe an action for a period or 'once'.
Indicates completion of an action.
